channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hundreds of Tourists on Yemeni Island Caught Up in Saudi-U.A.E. Rift
item.description: Around 600 foreigners have been stranded on Socotra as clashes on mainland Yemen halted flights, turning the nature sanctuary and tourist spot into a ...

item.title: Buy Greenland? Take It? Why? An Old Pact Already Gives Trump a Free Hand.
item.description: Analysts say the Cold War agreement allows the president to increase the American military presence almost at will.

item.title: Exclusive: Fireblocks acquires crypto accounting platform TRES Finance for $130 million
item.description: This is the crypto infrastructure firm’s second acquisition over the past year.

item.title: Minnesota fraud scandal gives Trump cover to withhold funding for kids in 5 Democratic-led states
item.description: Five states — California, Colorado, Illinois, Minnesota and New York — are targeted, and the HHS said they had been notified.

item.title: U.S. to Control Venezuela Oil Sales ‘Indefinitely,’ Energy Secretary Says
item.description: Chris Wright said the Trump administration was in “active dialogue” with Venezuela’s government about the plan.

item.title: Alaska Airlines to Buy 110 Boeing Planes as It Seeks to Expand
item.description: Alaska’s order, its largest ever, follows its acquisition of Hawaiian Airlines and is part of its plan to expand, including overseas.

item.title: ‘We do pranks and stuff like that’: Craigslist ad that sought 20 child actors for Minnesota daycare centers taken down after fueling fake news
item.description: Screenshots of the ad were used in social media posts on multiple platforms, cited as proof of fraud at Minnesota day care centers.

item.title: Venezuela Live Updates: U.S. Forces Board Oil Tanker in Challenge to Russia
item.description: The U.S. military intercepted a Russian-flagged tanker as part of its pressure campaign against Venezuela. It also stopped a second ship in the Caribb...

item.title: The Education Department is garnishing wages for millions of student loan borrowers in default. Who is affected and how much they can take
item.description: Wage garnishment "is a scary concept since they can take 15% of after-tax income," Ashley Morgan, debt and bankruptcy attorney and owner of Ashley F. ...

item.title: ‘Largest LBO in history’: Warner rejects Paramount again, scoffing at $87 billion worth of debt in its $108 billion bid
item.description: Warner continues to stick with Netflix, the shock winner that emerged in early December from the auction begun by Paramount.

item.title: Venezuela Live Updates: U.S. Forces Board Oil Tanker in Challenge to Russia
item.description: The U.S. military intercepted a Russian-flagged tanker as part of its pressure campaign against Venezuela. It also stopped a second ship in the Caribb...

item.title: Map: 6.4-Magnitude Earthquake Shakes the Philippine Sea
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.

item.title: Buy Greenland? Take It? Why? An Old Pact Already Gives Trump a Free Hand.
item.description: Analysts say the Cold War agreement allows the president to increase the American military presence almost at will.

item.title: Europe Tries to Come to Terms With Trump’s Intervention in Venezuela
item.description: Needing U.S. support to fend off Russia in Ukraine, European leaders have been cautious about criticizing President Trump on Greenland, Iran, Venezuel...
